full_title_en: PEDIS Score for Diabetic Foot Ulcers
medium_description_en: Predicts 6-month risk of amputation and mortality in diabetic foot ulcers.
instructions_en: Use in an inpatient setting in patients with diabetic foot ulcer of any duration. Do not use in patients with secondary diabetes or those with foot ulcers caused by autoimmune disease or malignancy.

seo.meta_description_en: The PEDIS Score for Diabetic Foot Ulcer predicts risk of amputation and mortality in diabetic foot ulcers.
seo.keywords_en: Diabetic foot ulcer, PEDIS score, clinical outcome, foot infection

how_to_use.use_case_en:
• Hospitalized patients with diabetic foot ulcer of any duration.
  • Do not use in patients with secondary diabetes or those with foot ulcers caused by autoimmune disease or malignancy.
how_to_use.why_use_en: Uses more objective findings than previous diabetic wound classification sytems such as the SINBAD and Wagner systems.

next_steps.advice_en: Diabetic foot ulcer management can be complex and should employ a multidisciplinary approach for long-term management, including primary care, endocrinology, wound care specialists, podiatry, etc as necessary.

creator_info.about_en: Fengning Chuan, MD, is an endocrinologist and researcher at the First Affiliated Hospital of Chongqing Medical University in Chongqing, China. Dr. Chuan’s primary research is focused on treatment of diabetes and infectious diseases.
